message:
BB Gun Causes Hospital Evacuation Hysteria
SoCal Martial Law Alerts
July 21, 2011

WHITE RIVER JUNCTION, Vermont — Evacuation hysteria ensued when VA hospital staff attempted to remove a BB gun and a knife from a patient's bag.

John Dugliss, a 60-year-old retired Navy veteran, was receiving treatment for an injured ankle at the White River Junction VA hospital when medical staff attempted to remove a BB gun and a knife from Dugliss' bag. Dugliss became distraught and barricaded himself in a room for 5 hours. He did not take any hostages.

Vermont State Police Captain Ray Keefe said, "There was a firearm seen by personnel in the hospital, also a knife and pepper spray. The subject was asked to leave, but would not leave. He got into that room and barricaded himself."

The hospital wing was evacuated as SWAT Teams and state police responded to the scene with automatic rifles, helmets and other tactical gear.

When Dugliss emerged from the room holding a knife and pepper spray, he was taken down by state police with bean bag bullets.

"The male emerged from the room, with pepper spray in one hand, and a knife in the other hand. At this point less than lethal wepaons were used on this person, and the subject was taken into custody," said Captain Keefe.

Dugliss was taken to a state hospital where he will undergo a psychiatric evaluation. He could face federal charges, because the incident took place in a federal building.
